content.description:
Start below a LFC. Climb up into the corner then left of the corner on obvious face holds using the corner/crack for pro. Once the holds run out make a tricky move right back into the corner, a #4 and/or #5 can be used. Continue up the corner to a bolted anchor. Rap/lower with a single 60m.

Follow the approach trail to the base. The first obvious LFC you’ll see.

Nuts, cams up to #4. A #5 could be placed higher up at the obvious wide spot, but it’s not mandatory.

North/northwest facing cragging area 5-6 pitches long.

This crag has some very high quality crack pitches! All belays are bolted, cruxes are short and well protected. All cruxes are also easily aided. Great for someone starting out at the grade. 

This wall faces north and receives almost no sun. It is one of the best summertime crags in the valley
